title: Zoe's RNG "W" is way too unreliable
body:
You either get lucky to get an item or spell every lane from a minion and get a huge advantage over your enemy or you can get super unlucky and don't get a single item or spell in 4 waves, which puts you on a huge disadvantage.
The RNG is too heavy for this.

Honestly I'm ok with things like crit, plants and the elemental dragons because its pretty predictable how often the RNG is going to affect things.  There's quantifiable amounts of chance and all of these mechanics have delays (You need to buy lots of crit for it to turn on, plants and dragons reveal where they are and what they are before spawn).  

However with shit like Zoe W and Kleptomancy it feels like the RNG is getting out of control.  There's like 10+ things you can get from Klepto, we know they're balanced in pools but if we're not given information on what the pools are or what the %s are then for all we know Riot could "rebalance" it and without weeks or months of tracking results across multiple players we'd actually have no idea if their changes went through or if they're bugged or if Riot fibbed about them... 

League is pretty math heavy and part of player skill is calculating plays in a split second.  If there's a bunch of hidden information on crucial game mechanics that can swing fights its honestly pretty bullshit.  I really don't mind having pools of RNG if its clear how they work because we can petition for change if it turns out to be imbalanced.

What do you even get out having this information laid out in front of you?    
Even if Elixir of Skill's chance to be stolen is 1%, what relevance does this have to you? It's not 1 attack out of every 100 because that's not how RNG works at all.

TBH Elixer of Skill is probably the most broken one since it can give you ult early and powerspike you so it probably shouldn't be part of Klepto, though if its a pool of about 15 items and they're bracketed into groups of 5 you can assume about 20% each which is about one crit chance item, its definitely way more predictable than a 1% crit rune.  Zoe is definitely more complicated with having something like 36 items but if they made it just summoner spells that drop off minions and it had a specified rate (maybe cannon minions only) you'd have enough predictable elements to be balancable.

Honestly I'm more concerned with it being balancable and having the numbers change if they're ass which is why it should be public, it'd also make it easier to argue how consistent/balanced these things are if certain elements should be removed.

So, what of it?
Her entire kit is so frontloaded into her Q + E combo and her passive is stronger than Lich Bane. The point of her W is to think on the fly, and to use these shards from your opponents in fights. In lane, you're very much safe from harm, so whatever you drop isn't going to cause you to instantly engage a player because if you don't have a clear path to land your E, your Q is super dodgeable and you're taking more damage then you're able to dish out in a trade.


Getting Redemption out of a minion isn't super helpful in an engage either. So is true for Smite. Youmuu's is the biggest offender here but even then, you could use it's active to run away, like a mini Ghost. But even shards like Ignite, Gunblade, Protobelt still fall flat because unless you know you can hit E, your only damaging ability can be dodged or you'll be forced to fire it off for less damage but from closer range. And Zoe isn't that great if you aren't making those long ranged Q shots on the fly.
